meanings.definition: To smile in an irritatingly smug, conceited, or silly way.
meanings.sent1: She was smirking at her own joke.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't help smirking when he won the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be smirking at the failed attempt to catch a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The mischievous child was smirking like a little imp.
meanings.sent5: Her smirking face revealed her satisfaction with the prank she pulled.

meanings.definition: A smug, conceited, or silly smile.
meanings.sent1: His smirking annoyed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her smirking during the teasing session.
meanings.sent3: The painting of the clown had a creepy smirking expression.
meanings.sent4: The villain's smirking in the movie sent chills down the audience's spines.
meanings.sent5: The politician's smirking in the debate made him appear untrustworthy.
